title: Lesson 60
paragraph: Adjectives for size, time and basic properties — useful for everyday descriptions.

words.meaning: of considerable or relatively great size
words.example: They moved into a large apartment.

words.meaning: after the expected or usual time
words.example: Sorry I'm late — the train was delayed.

words.meaning: having little weight; not heavy; also bright
words.example: This suitcase is light enough to carry.

words.meaning: small in size, amount, or degree
words.example: Could I have a little sugar in my tea?

words.meaning: relating to a particular area or neighborhood
words.example: We buy fresh produce from the local market.

words.meaning: measuring a great distance from end to end
words.example: They took a long walk along the river.

words.meaning: less high than normal; not tall or lofty
words.example: The ceiling is a bit low in this room.
The main goal is to finish on time.

words.meaning: relating to the present or recent times; up-to-date
words.example: They live in a modern house with smart systems.

words.meaning: of small width in relation to length
words.example: The street is too narrow for two cars.

words.meaning: existing in or caused by nature; not artificial
words.example: They prefer natural light in the studio.

words.meaning: required to be done, achieved, or present; essential
words.example: A passport is necessary for international travel.
